intro: Taraxacum taqueti, commonly known as the Taquet's dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves and a yellow composite flower head that develops into a distinctive white pappus for wind dispersal. Native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils. The plant is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, where it can spread readily due to its efficient seed dispersal mechanism. Its botanical features make it a notable example of the adaptive strategies of dandelions in diverse environments.
